entries.name: Firebrand Options
entries: The Firebrands use a variety of unorthodox equipment and techniques to achieve their goals, whether those goals include drawing attention, or subterfuge and subtlety. The following Firebrand options are {@trait uncommon}, and members of the Firebrands gain access to them once they reach the rank of second mark. The Entourage feat is rare even for members of the Firebrands, as it requires a certain degree of fame and in-world activity to acquire, and potentially requires the player or GM to keep track of additional background NPCs. Typically, only third mark and fourth mark Firebrands have the notoriety and social influence required to maintain an entourage. While Firebrands seek to build an entourage more than most adventurers, it's not unreasonable for any famous character to gain access to it if the players are interested in playing with the {@feat Entourage|LOCG} feat.

entries.name: Firebrands Feats
entries: The following feats allow Firebrands to easily hide among a populace or gather crowds around them.

entries.name: Firebrand Items
entries: The following are some of the items that Firebrands use to either gain extra attention or escape prying eyes.

entries.name: Firebrand Archetype
entries: The following archetype is available to prominent members of the Firebrands.

entries.name: Hellknight Options
entries: Hellknights incorporate a number of specialized techniques into their ventures. A character who is a member of the Hellknights has access to the following uncommon options, as well as to the scourge, which is common.

entries.name: Hellknight Equipment
entries: Hellknights employ a variety of equipment in their inquisitions. These include unique weapons that are a trademark for specific orders and the iconic Hellknight armor, Hellknight plate.

entries.name: Hellknight Armiger Feats
entries: The following archetype feats for the {@archetype Hellknight armiger|lowg} archetype are available to all Hellknight armigers and also to characters with the {@archetype Hellknight|locg} and {@archetype Hellknight signifer|locg} archetypes.

entries.name: Hellknight Order Abilities
entries: The following entries list the lesser and greater order benefits for each of the seven major Hellknight orders. These abilities can be gained by selecting the {@feat Order Training|LOCG}, {@feat Advanced Order Training|LOCG}, and {@feat Hellknight Order Cross-Training|LOCG} archetype feats described above.

entries.name: Order of the Chain
entries: Members of the Order of the Chain are skilled at hunting down and capturing criminals, especially those who dare flee from justice.

data.name: Shackles Of Law
sections: You attempt to subdue a target with an attack and a follow-up grab. Make a melee {@action Strike}. If it hits and deals damage, you can attempt an {@skill Athletics} check to {@action Grapple} the creature you hit. If you're wielding a {@item flail}, you can ignore {@action Grapple||Grapple's} requirement that you have a hand free. Both attacks count toward your multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after you've made both of them.

data.name: Sturdy Bindings
sections: Your grapples are incredibly reliable. When you roll a critical failure on a check to {@action Grapple} a target, you get a failure instead. In addition, when a creature you have {@condition grabbed} rolls a failure on its check to {@action Escape}, it gets a critical failure instead, and if it rolls a critical success, it gets a success instead.

entries.name: Order of the Gate
entries: The Hellknight signifers of the Order of the Gate seek to prevent lawlessness of all types through the use of their considerable spellcasting prowess and command of fiendish outsiders.

data.name: Locate Lawbreakers
sections: Your pursuit is relentless, and you are able to magically locate stolen objects and outlaws. You gain {@spell locate} as an innate spell of a tradition of your choice, which you can cast once per day. If you are a member of the Order of the Gate, when you reach 14th level, the spell is heightened to 5th level.

data.name: Devil Allies
sections: You can call in devils to assist your efforts. You gain {@spell summon fiend} as an innate spell of a tradition of your choice, which you can cast once per day. When you cast this spell, you can summon only creatures that have the {@trait devil} trait. At 16th level and every 2 levels thereafter, the spell is heightened by 1 level (to a maximum of 8th level when you reach 20th level).

entries.name: Order of the Godclaw
entries: The Order of the Godclaw's Hellknights see their cause as a holy mandate from the Godclaw. They seek to punish criminals with a zeal rarely matched by others who enforce the law.

data.name: Dedication To The Five
sections: Your dedication to the Godclaw borders on a cleric's. You gain the cleric's {@feat Domain Initiate} feat but must select {@domain perfection}, {@domain protection}, {@domain tyranny}, or {@domain zeal} as your domain. In addition, you can use any religious symbol of {@deity Abadar}, {@deity Asmodeus}, {@deity Iomedae}, {@deity Irori}, or {@deity Torag} as your divine focus.

data.name: Blessing Of The Five
sections: You call out to the Godclaw to heal your allies. You cast the 3-action version of {@spell heal}, heightened to a level 1 lower than half your level rounded up. You can select up to four creatures in the area to remain unaffected by the spell. You can instead use this ability to bring a creature within 30 feet that has died within the last round back from the dead. If you do, the creature is restored to 1 Hit Point and is {@condition doomed 1} for 24 hours.

entries.name: Order of the Pyre
entries: The Order of the Pyre is dedicated to eliminating those faiths and beliefs they consider to be a threat to the Inner Sea region. They are particularly keen on stamping out dangerous cults.

data.name: Righteous Resistance
sections: You can cast {@spell resist energy} twice per day as a divine innate spell, except you can target only yourself. If you grant yourself resistance to fire damage, the resistance is equal to either the spell's normal value or to your level, whichever is higher.

data.name: Spiritual Disruption
sections: You channel disruptive power that severs a foe's spiritual connection to their heretical magic. Make a melee {@action Strike}. If the attack hits, any time the target attempts to cast a {@trait divine} or {@trait occult} spell, the spell is disrupted unless they succeed at a DC {@flatDC 5} flat check (DC {@flatDC 7} on a critical hit); if the target is also {@condition stupefied}, it must attempt the harder of the two flat checks (but not both). This effect lasts for 1 minute.

entries.name: Order of the Rack
entries: Members of the Order of the Rack seek to eliminate wastefulness throughout the Inner Sea region. They seek to quash pointless dreams, quell rebellions, and destroy dangerous inventions.

data.name: Disillusionment
sections: Dreams are pointless illusions you seek to quash. If you roll a success on a saving throw against an {trait illusion} or {@trait dream} effect or a {@skill Perception} check to disbelieve an illusion, you get a critical success instead. If you roll a critical failure on any of those checks, you get a failure instead.

data.name: Silence Heresy
sections: You channel a power that stifles dangerous words. Make a melee {@action Strike}. If the attack hits, the target is unable to speak in a voice louder than a whisper for 1 round. This prevents the target from using most {@trait auditory} effects involving its voice, and it must succeed at a DC {@flatDC 5} flat check to {@action Cast a Spell} with a verbal component or the spell is disrupted. If your {@action Strike} is a critical hit, the target is entirely unable to speak for 1 round and is limited to a whisper for 1 minute thereafter. Once a creature has been affected by this ability, it is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

entries.name: Order of the Scourge
entries: Hellknights of the Order of the Scourge hunt those who pervert the law for their own selfish ends. They seek to destroy corruption and those who hide behind unjust laws and bureaucracy.

data.name: Fear No Law, Fear No One
sections: When you roll a success on a save against a {@trait fear} effect, you get a critical success instead. In addition, any time you gain the {@condition frightened} condition, reduce the condition's value by 1. As usual, this ability reduces the initial {@condition frightened} condition by 1, so if you have multiple similar abilities, they don't both take effect.

data.name: Seek Injustice
sections: With a moment spent focusing, you can locate the telltale signs of corruption no matter what means it may use to hide from your sight. For 1 minute, you can see through up to 5 feet of stone, wood, or similar barriers as if they didn't exist (though any amount of metal or denser barriers block this effect).

entries.name: Hellknight Archetypes
entries: The following archetypes represent fully inducted members of a Hellknight order. You can select the dedication feats for these archetypes even if you haven't yet gained three feats from the {@archetype Hellknight armiger|lowg} archetype. A character can't have both the {@archetype Hellknight|locg} and {@archetype Hellknight signifer|locg} archetypes.

entries.name: Knights of Lastwall Options
entries: The following feats and equipment are uncommon, but characters who are members of the Knights of Lastwall have access to them.

entries.name: Knights of Lastwall Class Feats
entries: The following class feats are available to Knights of Lastwall. Those with the {@trait champion} trait are {@class champion} class feats. Those with both the {@trait champion} and {@trait fighter} traits are both {@class champion} class feats and {@class fighter} class feats; when you take one of these feats, it loses the trait that doesn't apply to your class.

entries.name: Knights of Lastwall Focus Spells
entries: The Knights of Lastwall use powerful magic in their efforts to fight wickedness. The {@spell invoke the Crimson Oath|locg} focus spell is unique to the {@archetype knight reclaimant|locg} archetype.

entries.name: Knights of Lastwall Equipment
entries: The following equipment is available to Knights of Lastwall. The fauchard and armored skirt are common items.

entries.name: Knights of Lastwall Archetypes
entries: The following archetypes are uncommon but are available to members of the Knights of Lastwall. Qualifying characters with the {@archetype Lastwall sentry|lowg} archetype can select one of these dedications even without gaining three feats from the {@archetype Lastwall sentry|lowg} archetype, and each of these archetypes' feats fulfills the {@feat Lastwall Sentry Dedication|lowg}'s special requirement despite not being from the {@archetype Lastwall sentry|lowg} archetype.

entries.name: Magaambyan Options
entries: Magaambyans learn techniques to harness the power of the following options.

entries.name: Halcyon Spells
entries: Through hard study, Magaambyans can meld arcane and primal spellcasting. Halcyon spells are spells from the arcane or primal spell list. You don't gain new halcyon spells via the normal means you typically use to gain spells; instead, you gain new halcyon spells and new spell levels of halcyon spells only through feats. Halcyon spells are prepared or cast just like other spells granted by your class; for example, a wizard who gained halcyon spells would add them to their spell list and their spellbook, while a sorcerer would add them to their spell list and their spell repertoire. If you have more than one arcane or primal spellcasting class, you add halcyon spells to all such classes.

Each time you cast a halcyon spell, decide whether it is an arcane or primal spell. You can't heighten a halcyon spell beyond your maximum spell level of halcyon spell, even if you have higher-level spell slots, and you can't select a halcyon spell as a signature spell.

Each time you gain a level and learn new spells, and each time you gain a halcyon feat, you can swap out one of your old halcyon spells for a different halcyon spell of the same level; this is in addition to any swapping from your class, such as via a sorcerer's spell repertoire class feature. You can also swap out halcyon spells by retraining during downtime. If you have a spellbook, when you swap out a halcyon spell, you lose the spell from your spellbook entirely.

entries.name: Magaambyan Magic Item
entries: The following magic item is uncommon, but characters who are Magaambyans of at least attendant rank have access to it. PCs who start a game as members of the Magaambya typically begin at attendant rank.

entries.name: Mask Familiar Ability
entries: The following ability is available only to {@feat mask familiar|locg|mask familiars}.

{@b {@familiarAbility Mask Freeze|locg}:} When in mask form, your familiar can hide its obvious supernatural qualities to pass as a simple, unassuming mask. It doesn't need to Impersonate to fool a passing glance, and it gains a +4 circumstance bonus to its Deception DC against an active observer Seeking or otherwise studying it.

entries.name: Magaambyan Archetypes
entries: The following archetypes represent many Magaambyans. These archetypes are uncommon, but characters who are Magaambyans of at least attendant rank have access to them. PCs who start off a campaign as members of the Magaambya typically begin at attendant rank and thus have access to these archetypes.

entries.name: Pathfinder Society Options
entries: The following Pathfinder Society options are uncommon, but characters who are members of the Pathfinder Society have access to them.

entries.name: Equipment
entries: Many Pathfinders collect volumes of the Pathfinder Chronicles.

entries.name: Magic Items
entries: The following magic items are used by Pathfinders in their endeavors.

entries.name: Pathfinder Agent Feats
entries: The following archetype feats are available to characters with the {@archetype Pathfinder agent|lowg} archetype.

entries.name: Pathfinder Society Archetypes
entries: The following archetypes are uncommon, but are available to members of the Pathfinder Society (see page 65 for more information). Qualifying characters with the {@archetype Pathfinder agent|lowg} archetype can select one of these dedication feats even if they have not gained three feats from the {@archetype Pathfinder agent|lowg} archetype, and each of these archetypes' feats fulfills the {@feat Pathfinder Agent Dedication|lowg}'s special requirement despite not being from the {@archetype Pathfinder agent|lowg} archetype.
